titleproper.value: Guide to the New Leader Collection of Letters from Cuba <num>TAM.039</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-04-20T19:06:03</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: New Leader Collection of Letters from Cuba

abstract.value: Contains anti-Castro letters by Cuban residents, solicited for a never-published supplement to the <emph render="italic">New Leader</emph>.

p.value: Identification of item, date; <emph render="italic">New Leader</emph> Collection of Letters from Cuba; TAM 039; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Gift of the <emph render="italic">New Leader</emph> in 1963. The accession number 1963.023 is associated with this gift.

Norman Jacobs of the <emph render="italic">New Leader</emph>, a liberal anti-communist periodical, solicited letters from Cubans for a special supplement on Cuba under Castro, that was never published.

The collection contains approximately 100 letters by Cuban residents to United States relatives and friends describing conditions in Cuba. The letters, all anti-Castro, describe every-day life, the fates of acquaintances, objections to the regime and provide contemporary anti-Castro jokes and rumors. The collection includes the original letters as well as English translations.
